title: Arpepe 2011 Grumello Rocca de Piro Riserva  (Valtellina Superiore)
description: Initially shy, this opens up with a few swirls of the glass to reveal underbrush, truffle, pressed rose and a balsamic note. The tense palate is lean and linear, offering tart red cherry, strawberry, clove and mineral while bright acidity and firm noble tannins provide balance. Drink 2017–2022.

title: Barão de Vilar 2014 Cais da Ribeira Reserva Red (Douro)
description: This structured wine is balanced with great fruit, firm tannins and ripe berry flavors. Drink this impressive wine from 2019.

title: Basalt 2013 Rim Rock Red (Columbia Valley (WA))
description: Malbec (46%) makes up most of this blend followed by 23% each Cabernet Sauvignon and Merlot and finished with Cabernet Franc. It offers aromas of dark plum, currant, cocoa and spice that are followed by generous, textured and full blue and black-fruit flavors that bring a lot of hedonistic appeal. Coffee flavors linger on the finish.

title: Enoteca Five 2013 Merlot (Carneros)
description: Plummy cherry and vanilla meet cedar and black pepper wrapped in toasted oak in this bold, full-bodied, ripe wine from Moon Vineyards. Aged for two years in all French oak, it shows a classic structure and firmness, with succulence that builds on the finish.

title: Fincas Don Martino 2013 Old Vine Reserva Malbec (Luján de Cuyo)
description: Deep cool aromas of cola and toast blend with sweeter notes of maple and blackberry on this lush full-bodied Malbec. Flavors of blackberry, boysenberry, coffee, mocha and black pepper finish nicely on a well-cut, well-proportioned finish. Drink through 2020.

title: Fabre Montmayou 2014 Reserva Malbec (Mendoza)
description: Black cherry, blackberry and marzipan aromas are full, lusty and inviting. This has a chewy, full-bodied and layered mouthfeel to go with the dark-fruit flavors that are aided by spice notes. A peppery chocolaty finish is solid, ripe and friendly. Drink through 2020.

title: Force Majeure 2014 Estate Grown Parvata Red (Red Mountain)
description: A new offering from this winery, this wine is a blend of Mourvèdre (40%), Syrah (35%) and Grenache. Aromas of herbs, citrus, black fruit and light barrel accents are followed by rich, black-as-night fruit flavors that show a hedonistic styling.

title: Efeste 2013 Nana Red Willow Vineyard Red (Yakima Valley)
description: Merlot makes up half of this wine, with the balance Cabernet Sauvignon (40%) and Cabernet Franc. It announces itself with nuanced aromas of herb, dried leaves and flowers, along with black currant. The flavors are palate coating and textured, showing depth but also restraint.

title: Marchand & Burch 2014 Porongurup Chardonnay (Western Australia)
description: A joint venture between the Burch family (Howard Park) and Pascal Marchand (ex Comte Armand and Vougeraie in Burgundy), this Chardonnay comes from a hilly region deep in southwestern Western Australia. Toasted hazelnuts and citrus aromas set the stage, while the palate neatly balances richness and acidity. Bright pineapple and citrus blend with oak on the long finish. Drink 2018–2021.

title: Medlock Ames 2014 Bell Mountain Vineyard Malbec (Alexander Valley)
description: Robust tannin surrounds meaty, savory leather in this well-made red, blended with 11% Cabernet Sauvignon. Dried plum and tobacco accent pretty wisps of wild violet, making for a wine that's as perfumed as it is delicious.

title: Morlanda 2010 Vi de Guarda Red (Priorat)
description: Ripe earthy aromas of licorice, vanilla, cola and raisin set up a jammy pulpy palate with plenty of cushion. This is 50% Garnacha and 50% Carignan with flavors of plum, raisin and prune that are fully ripe, while ending notes of licorice and fleshy berry fruits run long and steady. Drink through 2020.

title: Sordo 2012 Rocche di Castiglione  (Barolo)
description: Rose petal, new leather, grilled herb and balsamic aromas escape the glass. The firm palate offers sour cherry, raspberry, star anise and a tobacco note alongside youthfully assertive but refined tannins. Drink 2019–2027.

title: Robert Biale 2014 Zinfandel (Rockpile)
description: From the rocky, high-elevation appellation north of Dry Creek Valley, this Zin is rich in baked and velvety layers of brown sugar and blackberry compote, with a softness on the palate. Full bodied, it pushes on ripeness but reins in any excess by coaxing lively acidity from the fruit.

title: Robert Oatley 2012 Finisterre Cabernet Sauvignon (Great Southern)
description: Well oaked, showing plenty of espresso-like char and brown sugar on the nose, this is a full-bodied, creamy-textured Cabernet. Mocha and caramel flavors continue the theme, backed by just enough cassis fruit. Drink now–2025.

title: Roco 2014 Wits' End Vineyard Pinot Noir (Chehalem Mountains)
description: This is the estate vineyard, and really shines in this excellent vintage. Flavors of strawberry pastry filling come up just short of jammy, while the aging for 18+ months in new and neutral oak brings accents of toast and vanilla. It has the stuffing to age nicely over the next six to eight years.

title: Rolf Binder 2015 Highness Riesling (Eden Valley)
description: It's good to see the Rolf Binder wines make a return to the U.S. market, as they typically combine high quality and reasonable prices. This Riesling is a bit atypically fleshy for the region, but that makes it more approachable than many at this stage. Floral notes, pineapple and citrus flavors finish with a hint of chalkiness.

title: Raptor Ridge 2014 Meredith Mitchell Vineyard Pinot Noir (McMinnville)
description: This vineyard selection captures the defining character of this tiny AVA—an underlying streak of gun metal, and an overall austerity that belies the complexity and subtle length of the wine. Tart cranberry fruit brings supporting acidity, and the wine rewards your attention with extra length and detail. Drink 2018 to 2028.

title: Reininger 2012 Merlot (Walla Walla Valley (WA))
description: A blend of fruit from Pepper Bridge and Seven Hills vineyards, this wine opens with aromas of vanilla, wood spice, cream, red apple and fruit. The palate brings elegantly styled, tart fruit flavors that linger on the finish. The balance is impeccable.

title: Sineann 2015 Red (Oregon)
description: This superb value mixes barrels from all the red wines in Sineann's portfolio. Predominantly Pinot Noir, Merlot and Zinfandel, there are small amounts of Cabernet Sauvignon and Petit Verdot as well. It's dark and spicy, the flavors well integrated. It adds up to a potent and powerful all-purpose barbeque red, loaded with black fruits and finished with a kiss of caramel.

title: Penny's Hill 2014 Edwards Road Cabernet Sauvignon (McLaren Vale)
description: Full bodied, extracted and tannic, purists may argue this wine is slightly overdone, while others will laud its chewy richness. Vanilla, cinnamon and fresh-cut lumber frame dark chocolate-mocha shadings. Drink it with rare beef or lamb to help balance the tannic chewiness, or hold it until 2020 and drink it over the next 10 years.

title: Perelada 2012 Finca La Garriga Carignan (Empordà)
description: All of Perelada's wines are made in a flush bullish ripe style, and this varietal Samsó, which is the name for Carignan in Catalan, is particularly intense, smoky and earthy on the nose. On the palate, it's juicy and ripe, with plum, berry and overt oaky flavors. A chunky finish deals cassis and prune flavors. Drink through 2025.

title: Quinta de la Rosa 2014 Estate Red (Douro)
description: Fruity and juicy, this attractive wine has delicious soft tannins that are already balanced with the ripe fruitiness, which suggests it will develop quickly. The wine comes from Pinhão the estate owned by the Bergqvist family. Drink from 2019.

title: Quinta dos Murças 2015 Margem Red (Douro)
description: Produced from the estate's oldest vines close to the Douro river, this is a structured wine with tannins and rich spiciness. It will develop gently, giving a wine that is structured without being too tannic. Drink from 2020.

title: Plozza 2012 #12 Black Edition  (Sforzato di Valtellina)
description: Underbrush, espresso, exotic spice and aromatic herb are some of the aromas you'll find on this hearty red. The full-bodied palate combines weight and finesse, doling out dried black cherry, nutmeg, licorice and mineral alongside firm but velvety tannins.

title: Poças 2001 Colheita  (Port)
description: This wood-aged Port is at a halfway point between the fruit of a young wine and the more woody, dried-fruit character of a mature Colheita. That makes for a wine that has some red fruits as well as raisins, with acidity both from the fruitiness and from the wood. Like any tawny Colheita, this wine is ready to drink.

title: Venta del Puerto 2011 No. 18 Vendimia Seleccionada Red (Valencia)
description: This blend of Syrah, Tempranillo, Cab Sauvignon and Merlot shows the upside potential of Valencia, one of Spain's low-profile regions. A nice mix of vanilla, root beer, spice, plum and chocolate aromas reflect 18 months in oak. With full stout tannins and deep ripe flavors of plum, cassis, tobacco and chocolate, this barrel-influenced middleweight should age nicely through 2022.

title: Tournon by Michel Chapoutier 2013 Mathilda Shiraz (Victoria)
description: This is full and richly textured without being overdone. Crushed stone and cracked pepper aromatics give it a nose that resembles some Northern Rhône examples, while the fruit is earthier and tinged with blackberries, then finishes with dusty tannins. Drink now–2020.

title: Saracina 2014 Big Shot Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Mendocino County)
description: Nicely concentrated fruit flavors and an especially rich, almost thick texture help this full-bodied wine stand out from the pack. Black cherries and blackberries spill out of the aroma and into the flavors, where they become quite vivid and lingering.

title: Nickel & Nickel 2013 John C. Sullenger Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Oakville)
description: This vineyard lies around the winery in the heart of the appellation, and it imparts lovely aromatics of dusty rose petals and mocha chocolate. Soft tannins wrap around a ripeness of baked plum, cedar, clove and earthy compost, with a shot of coffee on the finish.

title: Niepoort 2014 Vertente Red (Douro)
description: This wine is rich, smooth and full of black currant fruits. It has a dense texture although the acidity suggests a crisper side. It will age relatively quickly, giving a fruity wine that has layers of acidity.
